result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Rufus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: All financials placed on payment plan of $25 per week through income assignment

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed except for the purposes of employment. 
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.
NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH WITH KARLA RUFUS.

Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended. Follow through with all treatment recommendations of counselor.
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures and Other Financial Obligations & Notice of Certification

Defendant Michael J Rufus in court with attorney Joseph E Martell.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CM101 and 172. ADA agreement def 16CM101 plea ct 1 in 16CM172 plea to ct1 DRI ct2 and3, sentencing as outlined in Offer to Settle. Def plea NC to each count. Ct2 nd 3 in 16CM172 DRI. Ct accepts pleas and finds Def guilty.  State has complied with victim rights, statement victim early on in case, victims position has changed-now wants matter dismissed.  Ct notes restraining order in 16CV34 lifted on 7/19/16 (letter received 7/14). Atty comments on sentencing. Each count sent WH 1 yr prob

Defendant Michael J Rufus in court with attorney Joseph E Martell.  RDK appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Opposing modification of bond.  Not been compliant w/terms of bond as init set by the court which reflected upon new case  16cm172 just filed today.  Victim wants to stay married - Martel states wants change from abusive to no abusive.  Karla Rufus addresses the Court.  Court questions Ms. Rufus.  Rufus wrote a letter asking restrain order to be dropped.  Was alerted that restraing order dismissed so assumed it was okay to have contact - and not knowing anything about the bond or understanding.  In 16CM172 - RDK asks that bond be a signature bond and a no contact or whatever court agrees to amend to on other bond.   Court orders on 16CM172 - 2500 signature bond, MAS - No going into any place that sells alcohol, etc. no abusive contact with victim.  Court modifies bond in Case 16CM101 to no abusive contact.  16CM101 set for jury trial for 11-4-2016 - 09:00 a.m. as a #2 with keeping the status conference on 10-05-2016 for  16CM101.    On 16CM172 defendant stands mute, waives reading court enters a plea of N/G - STC set for 10-05-2016 at 08:15 a.m.
Motion hearing on September 14, 2016 at 12:00 pm.
Def's notice of motion and motion to modify bond.

Defendant Michael J Rufus in court with attorney Joseph E Martell.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Martell request final status  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 08:15 am. ADA comments wishes to point out that def is to have no contact with victim as condition of bond and the parties have been sitting next to each other the whole time. Offc Gilbertson to pull security footage should the DA wish to file bail jumping charges

Attorney Joseph E Martell in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Martell request another STC. Auth canceled, DAP  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Attorney Joseph E Martell in court.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty appr, auth filed, rec copy of compl, stands mute. Bond continues  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
